content.description:
Start up a small thin smear of ice for a body length and then transition right onto the rock. Pull increasingly steeper moves until you hit a puzzling blank section of rock at the 5th bolt, crank through the crux and finish on somewhat chossy rock at the bolted anchor.

Note: I have not been able to find the name of this route or any info on who put it up, if you do know who the FA was and what the actual name is, please shoot me a message and I will happily change this entry to reflect that.

The bolted line immediately right of Mental Jewelry.Â 
6 bolts to a bolted anchor.

Grotto Falls is an excellent beginner route that usually has fat ice and the crowds to prove it. Climb the initial steep section to the prominent flow that eases in steepness.  If the conditions are nice and fat, the curtain on the left, halfway up, forms and goes at about WI4. This curtain variation pitch can also be toproped with a bit of planning and on a slow day when no one else is lined up for the route.  This would be rare though and should be avoided if others are waiting to climb the route.  
  
 Can be done in one long pitch.

Located at the end of the canyon, uphill right from His and Hers. Climb up a long pitch with a prominent step in the middle that some will choose to belay at. The top has several trees that often have cord on them. The middle step often has v-threads in place as well.

Screws. There are two separate chain anchors located at the halfway platform (one on climber's left and one on climber's right), but it ices over late in the season and a v-thread is needed to rap the route.

left hand route above hers

9 bolts

Right hand route above hers

Bolted

The mixed line right of His. Start on a small smear of ice heading up for two bolts and then trend left for 3 more bolts until you transition to the ice of His. Finish at the bolted anchor on the right side of the top of His.

6 bolts to a bolted anchor.

The bolted dry tooling line immediately left of Sketch n Sniff. Clip an easy first bolt, struggle through the following two bolts until you hit the arching crack feature which trends right to the anchor. As the angle steepens the tool placements and feet get better.

Note: I have not been able to find the name of this route or any info on who put it up, if you do know who the FA was and what the actual name is, please shoot me a message and I will happily change this entry to reflect that.

Immediately left of Sketch n Sniff, 7 bolts that follow the arching crack feature right.
7 bolts to a bolted anchor.

The mixed line left of Hers. 5 bolts following good tool placements parallel to the ice followed by a transition right onto the ice of Hers, ending at the same bolted anchor used for Hers.

This anchor is also the starting point for the routes Introverted Extrovert (up and left) and Inverted Bisexual (up and right).

5 bolts to the bolted anchor at the top of Hers.

Mostly shaded area (it's a canyon).  This area can be exceptionally crowded, especially on weekends, due to it's close proximity to Canmore and Calgary.  The ice climbing is excellent quality if it hasn't been beat into utter submission.  
  
 The classics of the area include: 
 His (WI4) 
 Hers (WI4) 
 Grotto Falls (WI3)
